title: Possible Fix for Lag Spikes and Disconnections
body:
I was getting huge, random lag spikes and 'attempting to reconnect' all the time, but I was only having issues on League, nothing else lagged or gave me trouble. Since doing this I've played 5 games yesterday with zero lag and no disconnects, it seems to have fixed it. Noticed a few other people here have the same problem so I thought I'd share.

I disabled 'Interrupt Moderation' in my ethernet settings.

Network and Sharing Center > Change adapter settings > (right-click) Properties > Configure > Advanced > DISABLE **Interrupt Moderation**

Hope it helps! {{champion:51}}

replies.body:
Do you have any idea why this might help? From a brief look Interrupt Moderation tells the CPU to take action every time a package is received from the network, disabling it will instead allow it to backlog until the CPU is ready.

By my understanding, this *could* help hardware problems (CPU bottlenecks etc.), but it shouldn't help ping, most likely it would make it worse.

How's your system running now? Does it still work?
Tried this, think it may have stopped some of the lag but im still getting random 300+ spikes for no reason. Thanks alot for the info but man much appreciated!
